ANU.biography: Before joining CAEPR Kirrily worked at The University of Sydney examining economic inequality, and with researchers at the University of Technology Sydney and Charles Sturt University studying racism and the contributions of recent migrants to community development in Australia. She is currently completing a Bachelor of Visual Arts at the Australian National University's School of Art.

ANDS-Grants.description: This project will document the implementation of a major new government program starting in mid 2013 which focuses on employment/participation challenges among Indigenous people in remote areas. It will assess the extent to which the program achieves an approach which is both collaborative with Indigenous communities and integrated across government. It will also develop a conceptual, sociological anlaysis of the role of work in remote Indigenous communities and how this impacts on successive iterations of government policy in this area. The project's significance lies partly in adopting an exploratory approach to program implementation in which it is not assumed that objectives are clear at the outset, except in the most general of terms.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP130100226

ANDS-Grants.description: This project seeks to improve Indigenous livelihood options through a comprehensive analysis of recent reform of the Community Development Employment Program (CDEP). In examining the impetus for change and tracking outcomes, it will greatly advance understanding of appropriate responses to seemingly intractable Indigenous development problems.
ANDS-Grants.title: From welfare to work, or work to welfare: will reform of the Community Development Employment Program help close the employment gap?
